case.name: The Diamond District Heist
case.description: A collection of rare diamonds worth $2 million was stolen from a high-security jewelry store during business hours.

evidence.name: Security Camera Footage
evidence.description: The suspect was recorded browsing in the store 30 minutes before the theft was discovered.

evidence.name: Security System Knowledge
evidence.description: The alarm was disabled using a specialized technique. The suspect previously worked for the security company.

evidence.name: Phone Records
evidence.description: Cell tower data places the suspect's phone near the jewelry store at the time of the theft.

evidence.name: Recent Purchases
evidence.description: The suspect, previously in financial trouble, made several large cash purchases the week after the theft.

evidence.name: Forensic Evidence
evidence.description: A partial fingerprint found on the display case shares several points of comparison with the suspect's fingerprints.
